abstract: Supreme Court rules government program that sets prices for raisins by keeping quantities of raisins off market is unconstitutional, in case Horne v Department of Agriculture; eight justices agree that program amounts to government taking of private property, but only conservative wing of court supports ruling that Marvin D and Laura Horne are owed compensation.
lead_paragraph: The court said a program dating to the Great Depression was an unconstitutional taking of private property by the government.

headline.main: Supreme Court Sides With Raisin Farmers in Property Rights Case
headline.print_headline: Justices Side With Raisin Farmers on Property Case

snippet: The court said a program dating to the Great Depression was an unconstitutional taking of private property by the government.
